page.title: 19Narthex Project
page.content: Saint Bartholomew's church a 12. Century Parish Church fell into disrepair in the time of Cromwell.Since then only the Sanctuary and Eastern part of the nave have been used for weekly worship by the lively Christain congregation.In October 1983 The Church Council decided that it was essential for the livelihood and growth of the church,and for the well being of villagers and visitors that the church provide for basic ameneties and hospitality.An appeal was then launched for $25,000 for building with-in the ruined nave walls,the new building to be known as a Narthex.The Narthex to include toilet,kitchen,meeting room, choir vestry,clergy vestry sales kisok and storage.It was opened in November 1985.
